meanings.definition: To reduce to particles that are a few microns in size.
meanings.sent1: The machine can micronise the ingredients for better absorption.
meanings.sent2: She decided to micronise the sugar to make a smoother frosting.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to micronise the salt, but ended up with a cloud of dust instead.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush micronised the colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful blend.
meanings.sent5: The scientist used a special technique to micronise the sample, revealing its hidden properties.

meanings.definition: To make or become fine or granular.
meanings.sent1: The blender can micronise the fruits into a smoothie.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the rocks will naturally micronise into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to micronise the coin, but it disappeared completely.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to micronise the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The sandpaper was able to micronise the rough surface into a polished finish.
